346.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) officials on Monday visited 2,158 shops across Mumbai to see if they had put up Marathi signboards and found that 1,636 or 75% had complied. "There were 522 shops which didn't display Marathi boards. We have issued notices to them," a BMC official said. The third deadline for implementing Marathi signboards ended on September 30.

347.title: 191 drones entered India from Pak in 9 months, 7 shot down: Report
347.article_body: Security forces have observed the illegal entry of 191 drones into Indian territory from Pakistan in the past nine months, ANI reported after accessing an official document. While 171 drones had entered into Indian territory through the India-Pakistan border along the Punjab sector, 20 were spotted in the Jammu sector, the report added. BSF personnel reportedly shot down seven drones.

348.title: Cong must decentralise authority: Tharoor ahead of party's chief poll
348.article_body: Congress Presidential poll candidate Shashi Tharoor on Wednesday said that the party must decentralise authority and truly empower the grassroots office-bearers of the party. "If elected as Congress chief, important first step will be to call for polls to CWC to spread inner-party democracy further," Tharoor added. The Congress Presidential poll will be held on October 17.

349.title: Wipro's net employee addition falls to 605, attrition down to 23% in Jul-Sept
349.article_body: IT services firm Wipro on Wednesday said its net employee addition during the July-September 2022 quarter was 605 people, down from 15,446 employees it hired in the April-June 2022 quarter. Wipro's attrition rate for Q2 FY23 was 23%, down from 23.3% recorded in Q1 FY23. Wipro was the only IT major to report a fall in attrition in last quarter.

350.title: Bangalore University students call off protest on ministers' assurance
350.article_body: The students of Bangalore University's Jnana Bharathi campus have called off their protest which started after a BMTC bus ran over a 23-year-old post-graduate student on Monday. The students demanded a ban on the movement of public vehicles inside the campus. They stopped the protest after Karnataka ministers assured them that the issue will be discussed with CM Basavaraj Bommai.

351.title: Told Big B 'Marry me, I'm in love with you' when I was 10: Swetha Menon
351.article_body: Malayalam actress Swetha Menon recalled an incident when she proposed to veteran actor Amitabh Bachchan when she was a 10-year-old girl. She said Amitabh had come to Allahabad to immerse the ashes of ex-Prime Minister Indira Gandhi. "There was absolute silence...I reached Bachchan and told him to please 'marry me as I am in love with you'," she stated.

352.title: India never believed in expansion, particularly of geographical boundaries: VP
352.article_body: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar on Wednesday said any expansion, particularly of geographical boundaries, involves a violation of human rights and that India as a nation never believed in such a policy. In his address at the Foundation Day of NHRC, he said Indian ethos is such that the country's concern is not limited to itself but cares for the world.

353.title: Bombs, claymore mines hidden by Maoists unearthed in Maha forest
353.article_body: Police have unearthed two live pressure cooker bombs and two claymore mines which were hidden in a forest by Maoists in Maharashtra's Gadchiroli district. A pistol, two wire bundles and an aluminium utensil were also recovered. Police had conducted a search operation after receiving an input on Tuesday that Maoists had buried explosives in the area to harm security forces.

354.title: Delhi has received 128.2 mm rain so far this month, highest for Oct in 66 years
354.article_body: Delhi has recorded 128.2 mm rainfall so far this month, the highest for October in 66 years, India Meteorological Department said. Delhi had received 236.2 mm rainfall in October 1956, while the all-time record rainfall for the month, at 238.2 mm, was recorded in 1954. Rainfall recorded this month is the fourth highest rainfall ever recorded in Delhi in October.

355.title: Hyderabad Police busts ₹900 cr investment fraud racket, 10 arrested
355.article_body: The Hyderabad Cyber Crime Police on Wednesday arrested 10 people, including a Chinese national, for their alleged involvement in a ₹900 crore investment fraud spread across the country. According to a police official, raids were conducted on a few call centres operating from Delhi and other places, following which the network of the fake investment companies was broken.

356.title: Slower ones are not that effective against someone like Kohli: Harshal
356.article_body: India pacer Harshal Patel has said that his slower deliveries are more effective when players go deep in the crease and try to slog. "For someone like Virat Kohli, whenever I've played against him, he steps out and makes it a full toss and plays it through midwicket," added Harshal. Harshal has picked three wickets in his last six T20Is.

357.title: Aaj pehli baar laga bin suraj ke uga savera: Akhilesh after father's funeral
357.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav shared a tweet a day after his father Mulayam Singh Yadav was cremated with full state honours. "Aaj pehli baar laga…bin suraj ke uga savera (For the first time it felt as if morning arrived without the sun)," Akhilesh Yadav tweeted. He also shared two pictures from the site where the SP founder was cremated.

358.title: Crypto firm Blockchain.com gets Singapore licence a day after Coinbase
358.article_body: Blockchain.com, a cryptocurrency exchange backed by Lightspeed Venture Partners, has said that it has received approval from Singapore's central bank to offer services in the city-state. The announcement comes a day after cryptocurrency exchange company, Coinbase, received the same approval. There are total 18 cryptocurrency exchange firms allowed to operate in Singapore.

359.title: Who knew Modi before 2002 riots: JDU Chief Nitish Kumar
359.article_body: JDU chief Nitish Kumar alleged it was in the light of the Gujarat riots that headlines with the name of Prime Minister Narendra Modi appeared. "Who knew Modi before 2002 riots?" he said. "During the JP movement, I went to jail," he added. The remark came after Amit Shah accused Nitish Kumar of betraying Jayaprakash Narayan and siding with Congress.

360.title: Rahul walks with families of organ donors during Bharat Jodo Yatra in K’taka
360.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, during the Bharat Jodo Yatra, on Wednesday walked along with the families of people who donated their organs. The yatra resumed from Karnataka's Challakere today morning. "Today, Bharat yatris are joined by families who donated organs of their deceased loved ones. Their selfless gesture is helping raise awareness about this important issue," Congress tweeted.

361.title: 2 Delhi govt schools top EW India School Rankings, 'proud of my team', says CM
361.article_body: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Wednesday congratulated his "Team Education" after two Delhi government schools topped the EducationWorld India School Rankings 2022-23. Rajkiya Pratibha Vikas Vidyalaya in Dwarka's Sector-10 and Yamuna Vihar secured the first and second positions respectively. Kejriwal added that five of the top 10 state government schools in India are from Delhi.

362.title: Thane court fines 2 food joint owners for serving liquor without permit
362.article_body: A court in Thane has imposed a fine of ₹27,000 each on the owners of two food joints for serving liquor to customers without permit. The two owners were found guilty for offences under the Maharashtra Prohibition Act. The court also found nine customers guilty of consuming liquor at the two food joints, located in Bhiwandi and Kongaon.

363.title: Video shows man burning under a bus as policemen escape from the vehicle in Bihar
363.article_body: Three people were killed when a bus carrying policemen hit their motorcycle on the Chapra-Siwan Highway in Bihar. Video shows one of the three killed under the bus as it caught fire after its fuel tank exploded. Policemen can be seen rushing out of the bus. The man was allegedly dragged for about 90 metres, during which the tank exploded.

364.title: Vecmocon raises $5.2 million from Tiger Global & Blume Ventures
364.article_body: Deep tech EV solutions company Vecmocon has secured $5.2 million in a pre-Series A funding round co-led by Tiger Global and Blume Ventures. The startup was co-founded in 2016 by Peeyush Asati, Shivam Wankhede and Adarshkumar Balaraman, alumni of IIT Kanpur, IIT Delhi and ISB, respectively. In 2019, Vecmocon had raised $300,000 in a seed round led by Tessellate Ventures.

365.title: $1.5-million floating house prototype in Panama partially sinks during unveiling
365.article_body: A prototype of a floating house worth $1.5 million partially sank during its unveiling in Panama. The luxury SeaPod constructed by Ocean Builders comprised 'three half floors' and over 300 square feet of living space, housed 7.5 feet above the water. While pictures of the tilted SeaPod surfaced on social media, the company said "not a single person was injured".

366.title: Got admission to my school because of Amitabh Bachchan: Ishaan Khatter
366.article_body: Actor Ishaan Khatter revealed that Amitabh Bachchan helped him to get admission to his school. "He was the reason why I got admission to my school," Ishaan said, adding that the legendary actor "paid a personal visit to the authorities and the principal". Talking about Amitabh Bachchan, Ishaan shared, "There's so much to learn just by watching him."

367.title: Big score is around the corner: NZ coach Stead on Williamson's form
367.article_body: New Zealand head coach Gary Stead, on being asked about their captain Kane Williamson's recent performances, said a "big score" is around the corner for the 32-year-old. "Kane is one of the hardest workers I have seen on his game and he continues to be," added Stead. Notably, Williamson hasn't crossed the 50-run mark in his last six T20I innings.

368.title: Yoho raises ₹20 crore in funding round led by Paytm Founder, others
368.article_body: Footwear startup Yoho has raised ₹20 crore in a funding round led by Paytm Founder Vijay Shekhar Sharma, Softbank Vision Fund CEO, Rajeev Misra and Rukam Capital, among other investors. Founded in 2021 by Prateek Singhal and Ahmad Hushsham, the firm manufactures lightweight orthopaedic footwear using AI and state-of-the-art technology. Currently, Yoho only sells footwear in three variants.

369.title: 1st blow to Dogra culture: Mehbooba Mufti on Jammu voters registration
369.article_body: Following the administration’s order facilitating people residing for over one year in Jammu to register as voters, PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti said, "GoI's colonial settler project has been initiated in Jammu." She added, "They'll bear first blow to Dogra culture, identity, employment and business...BJP's attempts to create religious...regional divisions between Jammu and Kashmir must be thwarted."

370.title: SaaS startup MakerDojo raises $1.5 million in pre-seed funding round
370.article_body: Blockchain SaaS startup MakerDojo has secured $1.5 million in a pre-seed funding round led by Leo Capital. The round saw participation from US-based investors UP2398 and Jan Leeman. The company was co-founded in 2021 by Stanford graduates Priyank Chodisetti, Vignesh Aigal and Ajay Chintala. MakerDojo supports blockchain protocols like Celo, Ethereum, Polygon and NEAR.

371.title: Hyderabad Police seize ₹2 crore hawala money, 4 persons arrested
371.article_body: The Hyderabad Police busted a hawala racket on Tuesday night and seized around ₹2 crore cash which was being shifted illegally. Based on a tip-off, the Commissioner's Task Force (west) team along with Banjara Hills Police stopped a car and found the cash, after which four persons were apprehended. On Saturday, ₹79 lakh hawala money was seized in Hyderabad.

372.title: Next Budget to be carefully structured, inflation to be addressed: FM
372.article_body: The next annual Union Budget will have to be very carefully structured to sustain the country's growth momentum, Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said on Tuesday. "Growth priorities will be kept absolutely on the top. Even as I speak about the concerns that inflation brings before me. So, inflation concerns will have to be addressed," the Finance Minister said.

373.title: Beliefs hurt by distorting traditions, Aamir should keep this in mind: Minister on bank ad
373.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Narottam Mishra has criticised a bank advertisement featuring actors Aamir Khan and Kiara Advani. Mishra said that religious beliefs are hurt by distorting Indian traditions as the ad shows a couple reaching the bride's house and the groom taking the first step into the house. The minister said Aamir should do advertisements keeping this in mind.

374.title: Film festival in works to celebrate Dilip Kumar's 100th birth anniversary
374.article_body: Film Heritage Foundation (FHF) founder Shivendra Singh Dungarpur said that the organisation is planning a film festival to honour late actor Dilip Kumar on his 100th birth anniversary. "There's no better way to celebrate his legacy," Dungarpur said, adding that the challenge is to find the right material for the festival. FHF had recently organised 'Bachchan: Back To The Beginning'.

375.title: Over 250 startups working in geospatial sector in India: Minister
375.article_body: Minister of State for Earth Sciences Jitendra Singh said India has over 250 startups in the geospatial sector. He added that India jumping from rank 80 to 40 on the Global Innovation Index is a testimony to the country's progress in the last eight to nine years. Singh added that the geospatial economy will generate employment on a large scale.

376.title: UK economy shrinks in August by 0.3% due to fall in production
376.article_body: Britain's gross domestic product contracted by 0.3% in August, the Office for National Statistics said on Wednesday. The contraction was led by production and services falling back. Consumer-facing services contracted by 1.8%, with the largest falls in sports, amusement and recreation. GDP growth in July was revised down to 0.1% from a previous estimate of 0.2%, ONS said.

377.title: RBI cancels certificate of registration for 4 NBFCs
377.article_body: The RBI on Wednesday cancelled the certificate of registration of four non-banking financial companies (NBFCs), which are SRM Properties And Finance Company, North East Region Finservices, Sowjenvee Finance and Opel Finance. This move comes amid growing complaints against app-based moneylenders harassing borrowers over repayment. Four other NBFCs also surrendered their registration certificate.

378.title: TVS Motor beats Hero MotoCorp to become 6th most-valued auto firm
378.article_body: TVS Motor Company Limited has become the sixth most-valuable listed automobile company with its share price surging 72% so far in 2022. BSE data showed its market capitalisation reaching ₹51,071 crore after its shares surged 1.9% on Wednesday. TVS has surpassed Hero MotoCorp, whose market capital stood at ₹50,968 crore. TVS' stock has surged over 100% since its March lows.

379.title: Police identify 10 traffic hotspots in Ghaziabad ahead of festival season
379.article_body: Ghaziabad Traffic Police identified at least 10 major road junctions that witness heavy volume of traffic and frequent snarls and could add to the air pollution during the festive season. The identified hotspots are Bhopura crossing, New Bus Adda roundabout, Delhi-Meerut road, major markets in Indirapuram and Vaishali, Apsara Border and Lal Kuan, among others, the traffic police said.

380.title: Marco Jansen replaces Dwaine Pretorius in SA's squad for T20 WC
380.article_body: South Africa all-rounder Marco Jansen has replaced Dwaine Pretorius in their squad for the upcoming T20 World Cup in Australia. Pretorius sustained a fracture in his left thumb during the third T20I against India and was subsequently ruled out of the World Cup. Interestingly, Jansen has played only one T20I in his career so far.

381.title: Bengaluru-Mumbai plane lands with fairing panel missing; probe on
381.article_body: A fairing panel on one wing of an AirAsia plane, which was carrying over 140 passengers, was found to be missing during its post-flight inspection after landing in Mumbai. The aircraft had landed from Bengaluru. Meanwhile, DGCA has launched an investigation into the matter. Notably, a fairing panel is responsible for producing a smooth outline and reducing an aircraft's drag.

382.title: We know the 'Lakshman Rekha' but have to examine demonetisation: SC
382.article_body: The Supreme Court on Wednesday said it will examine the decision-making process behind demonetisation carried out in 2016 and asked the Centre and RBI to file affidavits regarding it. "We always know where the 'Lakshman Rekha' is, but the manner in which it was done has to be examined," a five-judge bench said.

383.title: Pic showing 1 AC split between 2 rooms at Mumbai hotel goes viral
383.article_body: A picture showing one AC split between two hotel rooms in Mumbai has gone viral. Podcaster Anurag Minus Verma said the hotel's manager had promised him a room with a split AC. He added, "It was literally a split AC room...One half in ours and rest in another where two uncles were playing 'Aye Ganpat chal daaru la'...in full volume."

384.title: Twitter reviews policies on permanently banning users: Report
384.article_body: Twitter is reviewing its policies around permanently banning users and exploring if there are other content moderation tools to replace a ban, as per a report. In May, Elon Musk said he would reverse Twitter's ban on former US President Donald Trump. However, Twitter is not considering reversing bans issued for breaching its policy against inciting violence, the report added.

385.title: Govt ready to talk with startups to make them stay in India: FM
385.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said the government is ready to address the concerns of the startups to make them stay in India. She added, "Engagement with the startups is what is going to help them to remain...within India. But, if there are temptations for which they...want to go outside, we need to understand how much we can entertain...on those courses."

386.title: Gurugram man calls NGO staffer to house for 'donation', molests her
386.article_body: A man in Gurugram was arrested for reportedly molesting a woman who works for a Non-Governmental Organisation (NGO). The accused reportedly called the woman to his house on the pretext of offering a donation. When she reached there he bolted the door and started misbehaving with her. As she objected, he started molesting her and even tore her clothes.

387.title: Demolish illegal constructions or face action: BMC to Goregaon Sports Club
387.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has sent two notices to Goregaon Sports Club in Malad (West) within a week, warning it of action against unauthorised constructions being carried out on the premises. According to the civic body, the club is violating fire safety norms. The club president, however, denied BMC's claim and blamed the opposition for spreading misinformation.

388.title: Stoltenberg's comment confirms NATO is fighting in Ukraine: Kremlin
388.article_body: Reacting to NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg's comments on Ukraine war, the Kremlin said it could be considered confirmed that NATO is fighting on Ukraine's side in the conflict with Russia. Stoltenberg had said that Russia's victory in Ukraine would be a "defeat for all of us". He had also said that Russian President Vladimir Putin is failing in Ukraine.

389.title: Coal India signs deals with BHEL, IOC, GAIL (India) for 4 projects
389.article_body: Coal India Limited has signed agreements with Bharat Heavy Electricals Limited, Indian Oil Corporation and GAIL (India) to set up four surface gasification projects. It aims to gasify 100 million tonnes of coal into syngas, which is a mixture of carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide and hydrogen. The projects would reduce forex outgo and create nearly 23,000 jobs, Coal Ministry said.

390.title: Govt to give ₹22,000-crore grant to 3 state-run oil firms to cover LPG losses
390.article_body: The Centre will provide a one-time grant of ₹22,000 crore to Indian Oil Corporation, Bharat Petroleum Corporation and Hindustan Petroleum Corporation, to cover their losses for selling domestic cooking gas LPG below cost in the last two years. These firms sell domestic LPG at government-regulated prices to consumers. Between June 2020-June 2022, international LPG prices rose by around 300%.

391.title: 'Yaariyan 2' to star Priya Prakash Varrier, Meezaan and Pearl V Puri
391.article_body: T-Series on Wednesday announced the sequel of the 2014 film 'Yaariyan' with an ensemble cast consisting of Pearl V Puri, Priya Prakash Varrier, Meezaan, and Yash Daasguptaa, among others. While the first film marked the directorial debut of Divya Khosla Kumar, 'Yaariyan 2' will be directed by Radhika Rao and Vinay Sapru. The film will release on May 12, 2023.

392.title: Over 20 arrested for allegedly attacking RSS worker in Karnataka's Haveri
392.article_body: Over 20 people were arrested for allegedly attacking a Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) worker at a village in Karnataka's Haveri on Tuesday night, police said. The RSS worker was at Rattehalli village for a path-laying work when the incident happened, as per reports. The victim was allegedly attacked by members of another community after an argument broke out, reports added.

393.title: Muslim man donates land for Hanuman temple in UP's Shahjahanpur
393.article_body: A Muslim man donated a portion of his land in Uttar Pradesh's Shahjahanpur to allow shifting of a Hanuman temple that was blocking a project to widen the Delhi-Lucknow NH-24, said an official. "Babu Ali gave one 'bigha' land situated close to the project to the administration," said Additional District Magistrate Ram Sevak Dwivedi.

394.title: Marksans Pharma's stock surges 12% after deal with Tevapharm India
394.article_body: Shares of Marksans Pharma surged by nearly 12% on Wednesday after it announced a plan for a business transfer agreement with Tevapharm India Private Limited. Marksans will acquire Tevapharm's manufacturing and supply of bulk pharmaceutical formulations business in Goa on a slump sale basis. At 2:50 pm, Marksans Pharma's stock was trading 5.68% higher at ₹49.30 apiece on the BSE.

395.title: Like Malinga, Wanindu Hasaranga is a competitor: Mahela Jayawardena
395.article_body: Ex-Sri Lanka captain Mahela Jayawardena has praised spinner Wanindu Hasaranga, stating that the 25-year-old has delivered in "tough situations" for his team in the last 12 months. "Once Wanindu crosses the field, like Lasith Malinga, he's a competitor...that's what I love about him," added Jayawardena. Wanindu was named 'Player of the Tournament' in the 2022 Asia Cup.

396.title: Dacoits thrash truck driver, loot cigarettes worth ₹1.3 cr on Mumbai-Ahm highway
396.article_body: Six unidentified armed dacoits reportedly looted cigarettes worth ₹1.36 crore from a truck on the Mumbai-Ahmedabad highway on Tuesday morning. They waylaid the truck near Sakwar village, beat up the driver mercilessly, blindfolded him and drove off with the truck, police said. After emptying the truck, they abandoned it and released the driver near the Charoti toll booth, police added.

397.title: 32 Solomon Island police officers head to China for training
397.article_body: A group of 32 police officers from Solomon Islands have been sent to China for training in policing techniques, the Royal Solomon Islands Police Force said. The officers would visit different police stations in China during their month-long visit. China has provided public order management training to police in the Solomon Islands since a security pact was signed in April.

398.title: I may not be most talented, but I'm the hardest working: Janhvi Kapoor
398.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor has said that people have the "biggest misconception" about her that she takes her position for granted. "I may not be the most talented or the most beautiful...but I can promise you that I'm the hardest-working person on the set," she added. Janhvi recently featured in 'Good Luck Jerry' and will next star in 'Bawaal'.

399.title: Couple hurt after ceiling plaster of house falls on them in Thane
399.article_body: A couple was reportedly injured after plaster from the ceiling of an apartment in a ground-plus-two-storey building collapsed on them in Thane on Tuesday. The 26-year-old man and his 22-year-old wife had occupied a flat on second floor of the building above a public toilet. They also maintained the toilet. Following the accident, the couple was rushed to a hospital.

400.title: Railway gateman found dead on tracks in UP's Sultanpur
400.article_body: A railway gateman, identified as Pradeep Kumar Mishra, was found dead on the Ayodhya-Prayagraj railway section in Uttar Pradesh's Sultanpur on Wednesday morning, police said. The deceased's family said that he had come home on Tuesday morning after work and left in the night, police added. The family suspects that the deceased was murdered, police further said.

401.title: 'Seduce Goddess Saraswati' to perform well in studies: BJP MLA
401.article_body: A video of BJP MLA Bansidhar Bhagat has gone viral on the internet, in which he can be seen asking students to "patao Goddess Saraswati" to perform well in their studies. While speaking to women on the International Day of the Girl Child, Bhagat said, "If you want power, Goddess Durga can be pleased."

402.title: Both India, Pak don't have enough all-rounders, it's been an issue: Nasser
402.article_body: Ex-England captain Nasser Hussain has said both India and Pakistan lack a proper number seven player in their squads for the upcoming T20 World Cup. "If you have a solid number seven, then...your top six can absolutely go for it. That has been an issue for India [and Pakistan]...Babar and Rizwan are so worried about their [batting] depth," stated Hussain.

403.title: Samsung to enable 5G support in its devices in India by mid-Nov
403.article_body: Samsung on Wednesday confirmed that it will be enabling 5G support in its 5G-ready Galaxy devices in India through a software update in mid-November. "In India, Samsung has the widest portfolio of 5G devices. We're working closely with our operator partners [to enable]...Indian consumers to experience 5G seamlessly," a Samsung spokesperson said. Apple will launch 5G support in December 2022.

404.title: Passengers escape unhurt as bus catches fire in Pune, video surfaces
404.article_body: As many as 27 passengers escaped unhurt after a private bus they were travelling in caught fire in Pune on Wednesday. As soon as the fire was noticed, the bus driver alerted the passengers and they managed to deboard it immediately, police said. However, the passengers' luggage was damaged. Meanwhile, a video has surfaced online, showing flames engulfing the bus.
